OM_Jaheira_COM.synopsis: Jaheira is reunited with her family, who thought her missing out in the shadowlands. Her eldest daughter Rion takes the lead, quizzing Jaheira on how she got back to the city and her silence since then.
OM_Jaheira_COM.how_to_trigger: - Go into Jaheira's house with Jaheira- Be spotted by the daughter (Half elf adult girl in the house)

OM_Jaheira_OOM.synopsis: Jaheira is reunited with her family, who thought her missing out in the shadowlands. Her eldest daughter Rion takes the lead, quizzing Jaheira on how she got back to the city and her silence since then.
OM_Jaheira_OOM.how_to_trigger: - Go into Jaheira's house with Jaheira- Be spotted by the daughter (Half elf adult girl in the house)

OM_Jaheira_COM_25.speaker: Jaheira
OM_Jaheira_COM_25.text: Oh, Malar's mark. Here we go.
OM_Jaheira_COM_25.context: CinematicNodeContext: We enter the hallway to find the little girl has run to a young half-elf and half-orc. They listen to her a moment, then stand to glare at the party; specifically, JAHEIRA. InternalNodeContext: The granddaughter has spotted Jaheira and reported she's coming, ahead of time.

OM_Jaheira_COM_40.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_40.text: Are we quite sure she hasn't actually died this time, brother? She looks dead.
OM_Jaheira_COM_40.context: NodeContext: Mock curiousity - speaking to her brother as if Jaheira isn't there. Looking her up and down and not impressed with what she sees.

OM_Jaheira_COM_31.speaker: Jord
OM_Jaheira_COM_31.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at Jaheira, speaking to Rion

OM_Jaheira_COM_37.speaker: Jaheira
OM_Jaheira_COM_37.text: It has been a hard road. But I can clip you both around the ear to prove I am no ghost, if it would help?

OM_Jaheira_COM_35.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_35.text: Forgive us, mother. We're just surprised you still know how to find your way home.
OM_Jaheira_COM_35.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, snarky - 'you can hardly blame us for being confused'.

OM_Jaheira_COM_34.speaker: Player
OM_Jaheira_COM_34.text: She wasn't exactly willing. I think she'd rather go back to the shadow-curse.

OM_Jaheira_COM_45.speaker: Player
OM_Jaheira_COM_45.text: Mother? Jaheira, these are your children?

OM_Jaheira_COM_46.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_46.text: She always brings the smartest people home, too.
OM_Jaheira_COM_46.context: NodeContext: Snort, mocking (not mean, just unimpressed)

OM_Jaheira_COM_19.speaker: Jaheira
OM_Jaheira_COM_19.text: Enough, Rion. I taught you better manners than that.

OM_Jaheira_COM_29.speaker: Minsc
OM_Jaheira_COM_29.text: Some battles, even Boo is not brave enough to fight.
OM_Jaheira_COM_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shaking his head, urging us not to get involved.

OM_Jaheira_COM_48.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_48.text: A Sending spell can carry twenty-five words. Do you know how many Jaheira's only message contained, in all this time she's been away? Seven.
OM_Jaheira_COM_48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ignoring Jaheira, to playerNodeContext: Bluntly steam-rolling over Jaheira, speaking directly to player: 'did you hear what this shit-head did?'

OM_Jaheira_COM_39.speaker: Player
OM_Jaheira_COM_39.text: This really isn't any of my business.

OM_Jaheira_COM_24.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_24.text: Hah - now there is a phrase Jaheira has never uttered. But no.

OM_Jaheira_COM_51.speaker: Player
OM_Jaheira_COM_51.text: 'Met. Gorgeous. Hero. Out. In. Shadow-Lands.' Is 'shadow-lands' one word or two?

OM_Jaheira_COM_0.speaker: Jaheira
OM_Jaheira_COM_0.text: The cleric who cast the Sending was wounded. Should I have sobbed on her shoulder?

OM_Jaheira_COM_17.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_17.text: The message went: 'I'm sorry. You know what to do.'
OM_Jaheira_COM_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: turning back to Jaheira accusinglyNodeContext: turning back to Jaheira, deadpan and unimpressed

OM_Jaheira_COM_41.speaker: Jaheira
OM_Jaheira_COM_41.text: So why haven't you done it? You were supposed to get the young ones out of the city.

OM_Jaheira_COM_6.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_6.text: And you were supposed to be dead. That's what your oh-so-stoic message meant, yes?
OM_Jaheira_COM_6.context: NodeContext: 'So what?' Not to be diverted by Jaheira's excuses

OM_Jaheira_COM_20.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_20.text: Yet here you are. So - what happened out there?

OM_Jaheira_COM_15.speaker: Jaheira
OM_Jaheira_COM_15.text: I got my skin saved by this one. We've come to take the fight to the cult - which is exactly why you all cannot be here.

OM_Jaheira_COM_27.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_27.text: Why? You plan on winning, don't you?
OM_Jaheira_COM_27.context: NodeContext: Brushing off Jaheira's warnings about the coming danger

OM_Jaheira_COM_38.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_38.text: You're the one who saved her, so tell me - are we all doomed?

OM_Jaheira_COM_16.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_16.context: NodeContext: Back to Jaheira: 'You should be more like this one'

OM_Jaheira_COM_26.speaker: Player
OM_Jaheira_COM_26.text: The cult is powerful - it's not going to be an easy fight.

OM_Jaheira_COM_22.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_22.text: So fight. That's what all you heroes and Harpers are for, isn't it?
OM_Jaheira_COM_22.context: NodeContext: Shrug - there's a job to be done, so do it

OM_Jaheira_COM_28.speaker: Player
OM_Jaheira_COM_28.text: You should really just listen to your mother.

OM_Jaheira_COM_44.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_44.text: Ugh. The one stern parent is quite enough, thank you very much.

OM_Jaheira_COM_14.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_14.text: Fine. Better in our home than quivering in some bush out in the Cloakwood.

OM_Jaheira_COM_10.speaker: Jaheira
OM_Jaheira_COM_10.text: You are a very irritating girl.

OM_Jaheira_COM_13.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_13.text: Ah-ah. This isn't your house, remember? You'll keep a civil tongue under our roof, if we let you stay at all.
OM_Jaheira_COM_13.context: NodeContext: Chiding. Not serious about not letting Jaheira stay, but forcing her to go through the motions of being judged anyway

OM_Jaheira_COM_43.speaker: Jord
OM_Jaheira_COM_43.text: Have mercy, sister. She's old, after all.

OM_Jaheira_COM_5.speaker: Jhessem
OM_Jaheira_COM_5.context: NodeContext: Chiming up, enjoying this bullying of Jaheira

OM_Jaheira_COM_23.speaker: Fig
OM_Jaheira_COM_23.text: She can stay - but only if she brought home presents.

OM_Jaheira_COM_18.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_18.text: Seems I'm out-voted. See, mother - that is how you go about talking things through with your family.
OM_Jaheira_COM_18.context: NodeContext: Sighing, relenting - but getting one last pointed dig in at Jaheira.

OM_Jaheira_COM_4.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_4.text: Now if there's more to discuss, then bloody well come in. And wipe your boots.
OM_Jaheira_COM_4.context: NodeContext: Moving on from the conflict immediately - she has better things to do.

OM_Jaheira_COM_1.speaker: Player
OM_Jaheira_COM_1.text: When surrounded by the enemy, every word counts. Be grateful she sent anything at all.

OM_Jaheira_COM_9.speaker: Jaheira
OM_Jaheira_COM_9.text: If you are trying to help me, please stop.

OM_Jaheira_COM_7.speaker: Player
OM_Jaheira_COM_7.text: This is a beautiful home. I figured Jaheira lived in a cave. Alone.

OM_Jaheira_COM_42.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_42.text: You know mother dear well already.

OM_Jaheira_COM_50.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_50.context: InternalNodeContext: The branch where the granddaughter hasn't been alerted and told them Jaheira is comingNodeContext: Deadpan, sarcastic - your mother Jaheira has finally deigned to turn up at your home

OM_Jaheira_OOM_0.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_OOM_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The branch where the granddaughter hasn't been alerted and told them Jaheira is comingNodeContext: Deadpan, sarcastic - your mother Jaheira has finally deigned to turn up at your home

OM_Jaheira_OOM_16.speaker: Jaheira
OM_Jaheira_OOM_16.text: Oh, Malar's mark. Here we go.
OM_Jaheira_OOM_16.context: InternalNodeContext: The granddaughter has spotted Jaheira and reported she's coming, ahead of time.

OM_Jaheira_OOM_12.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_OOM_12.text: Are we quite sure she hasn't actually died this time, brother? She looks dead.
OM_Jaheira_OOM_12.context: NodeContext: Mock curiousity - speaking to her brother as if Jaheira isn't there. Looking her up and down and not impressed with what she sees.

OM_Jaheira_OOM_19.speaker: Jord
OM_Jaheira_OOM_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at Jaheira, speaking to Rion

OM_Jaheira_OOM_9.speaker: Jaheira
OM_Jaheira_OOM_9.text: It has been a hard road. But I can clip you both around the ear to prove I am no ghost, if it would help?

OM_Jaheira_OOM_3.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_OOM_3.text: Forgive us, mother. We're just surprised you still know how to find your way home.
OM_Jaheira_OOM_3.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, snarky - 'you can hardly blame us for being confused'.

OM_Jaheira_OOM_11.speaker: Jaheira
OM_Jaheira_OOM_11.text: You're angry. I understand. But I tried to give you word of what was happening - a Sending.
OM_Jaheira_OOM_11.context: NodeContext: Keeping her own irritation down - Rion has cause to be angry, but Jaheira's own guilt is coming out as irritation

OM_Jaheira_OOM_4.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_OOM_4.text: The message went: 'I'm sorry. You know what to do.'
OM_Jaheira_OOM_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: turning back to Jaheira accusinglyNodeContext: turning back to Jaheira, deadpan and unimpressed

OM_Jaheira_OOM_2.speaker: Jaheira
OM_Jaheira_OOM_2.text: So why haven't you done it? You were supposed to get the young ones out of the city.

OM_Jaheira_OOM_21.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_OOM_21.text: And you were supposed to be dead. That's what your oh-so-stoic message meant, yes?
OM_Jaheira_OOM_21.context: NodeContext: 'So what?' Not to be diverted by Jaheira's excuses

OM_Jaheira_OOM_1.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_OOM_1.text: Yet here you are. So - what happened out there?

OM_Jaheira_OOM_8.speaker: Jaheira
OM_Jaheira_OOM_8.text: I got my skin saved - by blind, stupid chance. And the one who saved me is taking the fight to cult. Which is exactly why you all cannot be here.
OM_Jaheira_OOM_8.context: NodeContext: Same delivery as her previous: 'I got my skin saved by PLAYER'.

OM_Jaheira_OOM_15.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_OOM_15.text: Why? You plan on winning, don't you?
OM_Jaheira_OOM_15.context: NodeContext: Brushing off Jaheira's warnings about the coming danger

OM_Jaheira_OOM_17.speaker: Jaheira
OM_Jaheira_OOM_17.text: You might have noticed that what I plan and what takes place are not always the same. And if that happens again... the city might fall. The cult might come for you.
OM_Jaheira_OOM_17.context: NodeContext: Gritted teeth, self-deprecation in there but mostly frustration. Second line is her quietly stating her actual worry

OM_Jaheira_OOM_5.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_OOM_5.text: Fine. Better in our home than quivering in some bush out in the Cloakwood.

OM_Jaheira_OOM_20.speaker: Jaheira
OM_Jaheira_OOM_20.text: You are a very irritating girl.

OM_Jaheira_OOM_7.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_OOM_7.text: Ah-ah. This isn't your house, remember? You'll keep a civil tongue under our roof, if we let you stay at all.
OM_Jaheira_OOM_7.context: NodeContext: Chiding. Not serious about not letting Jaheira stay, but forcing her to go through the motions of being judged anyway

OM_Jaheira_OOM_22.speaker: Jord
OM_Jaheira_OOM_22.text: Have mercy, sister. She's old, after all.

OM_Jaheira_OOM_6.speaker: Jhessem
OM_Jaheira_OOM_6.context: NodeContext: Chiming up, enjoying this bullying of Jaheira

OM_Jaheira_OOM_10.speaker: Fig
OM_Jaheira_OOM_10.text: She can stay - but only if she brought home presents.

OM_Jaheira_OOM_13.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_OOM_13.text: Seems I'm out-voted. See, mother - that is how you go about talking things through with your family.
OM_Jaheira_OOM_13.context: NodeContext: Sighing, relenting - but getting one last pointed dig in at Jaheira.

OM_Jaheira_OOM_14.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_OOM_14.text: Now if there's more to discuss, then bloody well come in. And wipe your boots.
OM_Jaheira_OOM_14.context: NodeContext: Moving on from the conflict immediately - she has better things to do.
